All Items

From Project Diablo 2
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Below is a compilation of all "named" items - unique/set/runeword items and some others, whose affixes are all explicitly determined rather than generated randomly. Crafted items also have some predetermined affixes, but are not included here.

Other item compilation lists:

  • All Unique Weapons
  • All Unique Non-Weapons
  • All Set Items
  • All Runewords
  • New Equipment

  • 30 Runes and Gems
    • 30.1 Runes
    • 30.2 Gems

Axes

Unique Axes

All two-handed axes now gain bonus damage equal to 110% strength instead of 100% strength.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Also see Throwing Axes.

Normal One-Handed Axes

The Gnasher

Hand Axe

  • Base Damage: 3 to 6

  • Base Durability: 56 (was 28)

  • Base Speed Modifier: 0

  • Base Melee Range: 2 (was 0)

  • Base Maximum Sockets: 2 (3 for upgraded versions)

One-Hand Damage: 4 to [8-9], Avg 6-6.5 (was [4-5] to [9-10], Avg 6.5-7.5)

Required Level: 5

Before After
+[60-70]% Enhanced Damage +[40-50]% Enhanced Damage
20% Chance of Crushing Blow 20% Chance of Crushing Blow
50% Chance of Open Wounds 50% Chance of Open Wounds
+2 Open Wounds Damage per Second
+8 to Strength +8 to Strength

Deathspade

Axe

  • Base Damage: 4 to 11

  • Base Durability: 48 (was 24)

  • Base Speed Modifier: 10

  • Base Melee Range: 2 (was 1)

One-Hand Damage: 14 to [17-18], Avg 15.5-16

Required Strength: 32

Required Level: 9

Before After
+[60-70]% Enhanced Damage +[60-70]% Enhanced Damage
+8 to Minimum Damage +8 to Minimum Damage
10% Deadly Strike
15% Bonus to Attack Rating 15% Bonus to Attack Rating
Hit Blinds Target Hit Blinds Target
+4 to Mana after each Kill +4 to Mana after each Kill

Maces

Unique Maces

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Wirt's Leg

Durability: 66

Speed Modifier: -10

Melee Range: 1

Maximum Sockets: 3

Required Level: None

Before After
+50% Damage to Undead +50% Damage to Undead

This is a regular item that can be used to open the Secret Cow Level. It can also be imbued, turned into a magic item to craft with, or used as a runeword base like other regular items. It is considered a club, so can now get Druid pointmods/staffmods like other clubs.

This is a unique quest item.


Swords

Unique Swords

All one-handed swords now gain bonus damage equal to 75% strength & 75% dexterity instead of 100% strength.

All two-handed swords now gain bonus damage equal to 110% strength instead of 100% strength.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Daggers

Unique Daggers

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Also see Throwing Daggers.

Throwing Weapons

Unique Throwing Weapons

Throwing weapons now have unlimited quantity.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

See Class Weapons for unique Amazon Javelins.

Special Throwing Weapons

  • Throwing potions now reduce enemy resistances
  • New versions of throwing potions are now available for the cold and lightning elements

Low Throwing Potions

Fulminating Potion

Throw Damage: 5 to 15 (fire)

Enemy Fire Resistances: -3%

Required Level: None

Throw Damage: 19 over 3 seconds (poison)

Enemy Poison Resistances: -3%

Required Level: 6

Chilling Potion

Throw Damage: 3 to 6 (cold)

Enemy Cold Resistances: -3%

Required Level: None

Charged Potion

Throw Damage: 1 to 14 (lightning)

Enemy Lightning Resistances: -3%

Required Level: 6

Throw Damage: 16 to 30 (fire)

Enemy Fire Resistances: -6%

Required Level: 12

Throw Damage: 72 over 3 seconds (poison)

Enemy Poison Resistances: -6%

Required Level: 16

Throw Damage: 10 to 22 (cold)

Enemy Cold Resistances: -6%

Required Level: 12

Throw Damage: 1 to 46 (lightning)

Enemy Lightning Resistances: -6%

Required Level: 16

Throw Damage: 26 to 64 (fire)

Enemy Fire Resistances: -10%

Required Level: 20

Throw Damage: 96 over 3 seconds (poison)

Enemy Poison Resistances: -10%

Required Level: 24

Throw Damage: 20 to 42 (cold)

Enemy Cold Resistances: -10%

Required Level: 20

Shock Potion

Throw Damage: 1 to 88 (lightning)

Enemy Lightning Resistances: -10%

Required Level: 24


Spears

Unique Spears

All non-class spears now gain bonus damage equal to 75% strength & 75% dexterity instead of 100% strength.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

See Class Weapons for unique Amazon Spears. Also see Throwing Spears (Javelins).

Required Level: 8

Polearms

Unique Polearms

All polearms now gain bonus damage equal to 75% strength & 75% dexterity instead of 100% strength.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Bows

Unique Bows

All bows now gain bonus damage equal to 50% dexterity instead of 100% dexterity.

See Class Weapons for unique Amazon Bows.

Scepters

Unique Scepters

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Normal Scepters

Scepter

  • Base Damage: 6 to 11

  • Base Durability: 100 (was 50)

  • Base Speed Modifier: 0

  • Base Melee Range: 2 (was 0)

  • Base Maximum Sockets: 2 (3 for upgraded versions)

One-Hand Damage: 10 to [18-19], Avg 14-14.5

Required Strength: 25

Required Level: 5

+50% Damage to Undead +50% Damage to Undead

Staves

Unique Staves

All staves now gain bonus damage equal to 110% strength instead of 100% strength.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Normal Staves

Bane Ash

Short Staff

  • Base Damage: 1 to 5

  • Base Durability: 40 (was 20)

  • Base Speed Modifier: -10

  • Base Melee Range: 2 (was 1)

  • Base Maximum Sockets: 2 (3 for upgraded versions)

Two-Hand Damage: 1 to [7-8], Avg 4-4.5

Required Level: 5

Before After
20% Chance to Cast Level 8 Fire Bolt on Casting
+[1-2] to Fire Skills
+20% Increased Attack Speed +20% Increased Attack Speed
+10% Faster Cast Rate
+[50-60]% Enhanced Damage +[50-60]% Enhanced Damage
Adds 4-6 Fire Damage Removed
+2 to Warmth (Sorceress Only) Removed
+5 to Fire Bolt (Sorceress Only) +3 to Fire Bolt (Sorceress Only)
+30 to Mana +30 to Mana
Fire Resist +50% Fire Resist +50%
+50% Damage to Undead +50% Damage to Undead

Class Weapons

Unique Class Weapons

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Ethereal weapons gain a x1.25 damage bonus instead of a x1.5 damage bonus.

Amazon

Bows

All bows now gain bonus damage equal to 50% dexterity instead of 100% dexterity.

*The Energy Shield granted by this weapon counts as "hard" points, meaning it will have absorption efficiency equal to 16 skill points invested.

  • Lesser Fade has a 30 second duration and provides +2% all resist, 1% physical damage reduction, and ~3% curse duration reduction per level. Level 10 Lesser Fade grants +20% all res, +10% pdr, and 28% curse duration reduction. Lesser Fade does not stack with Fade or Burst of Speed, and will override them.

Socketed (1)
  • Bone Nova sends Teeth-like projectiles in all directions.
  • Amulets can't normally have sockets. Socketed items add the same stats that they would for chests or helms.

This item drops exclusively from Rathma.

Common Sets

Common Sets

Set bonuses are listed separately rather than cumulatively - if multiple bonuses add the same attributes, those bonuses will be added together before taking effect.

Set items may be ethereal. They may also be upgraded. Unless upgraded, common sets only include normal bases.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Uncommon Sets

Uncommon Sets

Set bonuses are listed separately rather than cumulatively - if multiple bonuses add the same attributes, those bonuses will be added together before taking effect.

Set items may be ethereal. They may also be upgraded.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Class-Focused Sets

Class-Focused Sets

Set bonuses are listed separately rather than cumulatively - if multiple bonuses add the same attributes, those bonuses will be added together before taking effect.

Set items may be ethereal. They may also be upgraded.

In addition to the changes listed here, all melee weapons also gain Melee Attacks Deal Splash Damage.

Runewords can only be made in regular items (ethereal or non-ethereal), and the socket count must be exact. They cannot be made in items whose rarity is magic or higher.

Runeword changes include rune changes.

Runeword Shields

Shield Runewords

Runewords can only be made in regular items (ethereal or non-ethereal), and the socket count must be exact. They cannot be made in items whose rarity is magic or higher.

Runeword changes include rune changes.

Ancient's Pledge

3-Socket Shields

Ral • Ort • Tal

Required Level: 21

Before After
+50% Enhanced Defense +50% Enhanced Defense
Cold Resist +43% Cold Resist +43%
Lightning Resist +48% Lightning Resist +48%
Fire Resist +48% Fire Resist +48%
Poison Resist +48% Poison Resist +48%
10% Damage Taken Gained as Mana when Hit 10% Damage Taken Gained as Mana when Hit

Ancient's Pledge is an introductory runeword and adds relatively little to the item beyond the +35% fire/lightning/poison resists gained from the runes themselves. Compare to 3 perfect diamonds, which grants +57% to all resistances.

Runeword Weapons

Item Base Requirements

Runewords can only be made in regular items, and the socket count must be exact. They cannot be made in items whose rarity is magic or higher.

Melee Weapons include all non-ranged weapons except Orbs. Technically, Wands are still classified as melee weapons despite their similarities to orbs and lack of melee splash damage.

Note that the in-game tooltips can sometimes be misleading since they refer to weapon "super-types" rather than the "sub-types" that are relevant in most scenarios.

  • Wands/Orbs are not part of the Staff sub-type
  • Scepters are not part of the (Tipped) Mace sub-type
  • Clubs, Tipped Maces, and Hammers are all commonly referred to as Maces, but Clubs/Hammers are not part of the (Tipped) Mace sub-type. To help differentiate the Mace super-type and Mace sub-type, the latter is called "Tipped Maces" instead.
    • Clubs:
      • Club, Cudgel, Truncheon
      • Spiked Club, Barbed Club, Tyrant Club
    • Tipped Maces:
      • Mace, Flanged Mace, Reinforced Mace
      • Morning Star, Jagged Star, Devil Star
      • Flail, Knout, Scourge
    • Hammers:
      • War Hammer, Battle Hammer, Legendary Mallet
      • Maul, War Club, Ogre Maul
      • Great Maul, Martel de Fer, Thunder Maul

General Changes

  • Many weapon runewords can be made in additional bases:
    • All runewords that can be made in Polearms can now also be made in Spears (Crescent Moon, Insight, Obedience, Rift, Infinity, Destruction, Doom, Pride)
    • Staves can now also be used to make: Spirit, Beast, Infinity, Destruction, Last Wish, Doom, Pride
    • Claws can now also be used to make: Steel, King's Grace, Black, Lawbringer, Crescent Moon
    • Famine can be made in Swords (in addition to Axes/Hammers)
    • Rift can be made in Swords (in addition to Scepters/Polearms and now Spears)
    • Doom can be made in Swords/Scepters (in addition to Axes/Hammers/Polearms and now Spears/Staves)
    • Insight can be made in Scepters (in addition to Staves/Polearms and now Spears)
    • Voice of Reason can be made in Bows/Crossbows (in addition to Swords/Tipped Maces)
    • Obedience can be made in Hammers (in addition to Polearms and now Spears)
  • Added new runewords:
    • Pattern (was present in vanilla, but disabled)
    • Plague (was present in vanilla, but disabled)
    • Neophyte
    • Rampage
    • Dominion
    • Zenith
    • Unbending Will (from D2 Resurrected)
    • Mist (from D2 Resurrected)
    • Obsession (from D2 Resurrected)
    • Asylum
  • Runeword changes include rune changes

Runes and Gems

Runes

All runes are now stackable. Runes can be switched between their stacked and unstacked forms with shortcuts, and can only be placed in items when in their unstacked form.

For rune effects that have been changed, changes are shown in blue with the original effects shown in gray.

# Rune Name Level Weapon Chest/Helm Shield Group

+1 to Light Radius		 +15 Defense,
+1 to Light Radius		 +15 Defense,

+5% to Maximum Cold Resist		 +4% to Maximum Cold Resist
+5% to Maximum Cold Resist		 High
28 Lo 59 20% Deadly Strike +4% to Maximum Lightning Resist
+5% to Maximum Lightning Resist		 +4% to Maximum Lightning Resist
+5% to Maximum Lightning Resist		 High
29 Sur 61 +4 Life after each Kill
Hit Blinds Target		 Increase Maximum Mana 5% +50 to Mana High
30 Ber 63 20% Chance of Crushing Blow Physical Damage Taken Reduced by 5%
Physical Damage Taken Reduced by 8%		 Physical Damage Taken Reduced by 5%
Physical Damage Taken Reduced by 8%		 High
31 Jah 65 Ignore Target's Defense Increase Maximum Life 5% +75 to Life
+50 to Life		 High
32 Cham 67 Freezes Target +3 Cannot Be Frozen Cannot Be Frozen High
33 Zod 69 Indestructible Indestructible Indestructible High

The term "high rune" refers to any rune that cannot drop from the Hellforge quest, which is Vex or higher. It is not to be confused with the troublesomely-named "HR" unit of currency, which can be used with any sufficiently-valuable item rather than just high runes.

High runes typically form the core of market trading currencies due to their rarity and general usefulness, while upper "mid runes" (Lem through Gul) are close enough in value to be traded in a similar fashion, especially during the beginning of each ladder season. Below Lem, rune values are too low for individual runes to be practically referred to in terms of HRs, and are traded more often in bulk rather than as individual tokens of currency. Beyond runes, few items are used as ubiquitously as currency, with the most notable exception being Worldstone Shards.

Gems

Flawless and Perfect gems are now stackable. Flawless gems now begin dropping in Act 4 Normal, and Perfect gems can now drop in Hell.

Gem effects have not been changed from vanilla D2, but are included here for convenience.

Gem Name Level Weapon Chest/Helm Shield
Chipped Sapphire 1 Adds 1-3 Cold Damage +10 to Mana Cold Resist +12%
Flawed Sapphire 5 Adds 3-5 Cold Damage +17 to Mana Cold Resist +16%
Sapphire 12 Adds 4-7 Cold Damage +24 to Mana Cold Resist +22%
Flawless Sapphire 15 Adds 6-10 Cold Damage +31 to Mana Cold Resist +28%
Perfect Sapphire 18 Adds 10-14 Cold Damage +38 to Mana Cold Resist +40%
Chipped Emerald 1 +10 Poison Damage over 3 Seconds +3 to Dexterity Poison Resist +12%
